Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2010 01:25PM nancyjg wrote: Laurakay, I too am so, so sorry.  Hugs and prayers. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2010 06:06AM nancyjg wrote: Thanks Roseann.  I don't know how this works so I don't know what pm means.  It is hard to know how to react to this.  I know in my heart that the radiologist who read the ultrasound and did the biopsy thinks my result will be positive.  I know this to be true.  He used terms like "very worrisome" and said "I am not saying you have breast cancer."  But when I asked what I could research on line he wrote DCIS and IDC.  I don't know.  I am not trying to convince myself it will be positive but I also feel I need to be as informed as I can.  My husband says just wait and see what happens, but I think we need to prepare ourselves for worst case.  Also, if I get bad news on Thursday I will want to call a breast surgeon immediately.  (which means knowing I'm calling someone good.  experienced, compassionate, etc.)  The radiologist also recommended researching breast surgeons, although he did recommend one.  I think I'm still numb.  Not my breast, though, that hurts.  Thanks for the book recommendations, maybe I'll hit Borders today.  I think I need to keep busy. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 11:14PM nancyjg wrote: Hi Maria, I can definitely understand and relate to how you are feeling.  There is a part of me that wants to scream Hey, don't you get it?  I might have bc!  I might really have it!  But of course I hold it in and don't cry and go through each minute like a puppet  faking emotion and normality. (Sorry about the drama but it's 2 am.  My sleeping pills really don't last long enough, but I may still be goofy from it)  Truly, though, we will have nothing to be embarrassed about if we are fortunate enough to have b9 findings.  We will still not be finished with this crisis.  I for one will have to get this awful lump removed.  I couldn't live with it in me. Anyway, I wish you low stress, good luck on your biopsy, and b9, b9, b9. Good night, I hope, Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2010 05:48PM nancyjg wrote: Thanks Nancy. This is my first day of waiting and I've already made a connection with three women around the country.  I can see this is going to be a place where I spend some time over the next few days.  In my dining room, but maybe not so stuck in my own head.  Speaking of stuck in my own head, each of you has a unique and difficult story and here I am thinking about myself!  I can't imagine what so many women have gone through and are going through and I wonder at your strength.  I do have some medication for antianxiety and also sleep, although what I always thought was a strong sleeping pill gave me about three hours last night!  At least I know that whatever is in store for me I will be able to arm myself with knowledge and some guidance.  That seems like the most important thing to me right now.  I know I may have an unexpected and unthinkable path ahead of me.  It's funny, I don't think of myself as the dramatic type, but I definitely feel like a drama queen right now!  Again, thanks everybody. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 06:22AM nancyjg wrote: Amen.  I feel the same way.  Every so often I let my mind wander and get really sick to my stomach.  My kids are 20 and 23 and in college and law school and I get really worried about this affecting their grades.  They are  both straight a students and I want them to stay that way.  Expressing that makes it seem silly and small in the scheme of things, but it is very important to me.  I worry about their futures.  I need to keep reminding myself that in several days it may all be over (except for lumpectomy, that's pretty much a given at this point) and I will look back and wonder why I tortured myself. . . or my future may be hugely altered.  I don't know where all these women get their strength.  I keep praying that I will be able to face whatever is coming with strength and grace.  And right now, my hands are shaking so much I can barely type.  I will be alone all day until about 6.   That seems like interminable hours stretching out in front of me.  I don't know how to get through the next few days until I know what's really going on.  I keep thinking that if I just call early my results will miraculously be in. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: nancyjg wrote: Had a mammogram 2/08, had repeat and ultrasound of left breast 2/12, and they did core biopsy.  The results are not due until Thursday 2/18 because of the holiday Monday.  I think I will be crazy by then.  So far I've been holding together very well, but don't think I'll ever sleep.  I have a Cat. 4 dense, irregular, possibly peaked 1.3cm x  1.3cm x .9 cm mass with calcifications and increased blood flow.  I know I shouldn't read too much into it, but I know the radiologist thinks malignancy.  Time will tell.  In the meantime, what should I be doing to make good use of this time? Dx 2/18/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 08:22AM nancyjg wrote: Thanks, DaylilyFan.  Does 0/4 nodes mean they found no cancer in 4 nodes removed?  I guess I'm feeling knowledge is power and am trying to learn all I can.  Hope it's okay to ask. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 09:06AM nancyjg wrote: Thanks, AWHome.  I just got got a call from the radiologist to tell me that my results are not yet finalized and that I should be hearing from him again in a few hours.  I got that same impression from the radiologist who did the biopsy and even the technician.  The density, irregularity, calcifications, etc. sound like bad news might be coming.  I wonder if you can really prepare yourself prior to hearing the words.  Or if it even makes sense to try.  I will keep faith and hope. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 03:18AM nancyjg wrote: Oh, Laurakay, I know just what you mean.  I feel like I should be able show up at some lab and say, No, you don't understand, I need to know now!  President's Day may have held things up for you, I know it's adding a day for me.  I don't know how I'll make it to Thursday.  I can't make small decisions like what to make for dinner.  It's like being fully functional, but in slow motion.  I need to talk about it, but I don't KNOW anything so the topic feels off limits.  Hang in there, pray we both hear benign. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 11:33PM nancyjg wrote: Seaside Memories, thanks for the advice.  Good advice from you caring women is what we need right now to know how to keep moving forward.  I agree that the kids should be kept in the loop through all of this.  My daughter (20) is living at home for the next 6 months doing a work coop, and my son(23) lives an hour away at school.  I called him right after the biopsy.  Even though I could have saved him the worry if the results are benign, I felt it important to keep him a part of this from the beginning.  He's really my sensitive one when it comes to things like this.  Time to log off and try to get a few hours before daylight. Thanks again Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 06:44AM nancyjg wrote: Jennifer, Thank you.  I already have this big fight in my head that I will have to have with them to go look for the results.  The radiologist who did the biopsy gave me his card and said to call the office (he is away this week.)  He said he would talk to the other partners and let them know I would be calling.   But. . . I called anyway and the woman who answered said that it could take up to seven days.  I'm at 6 days, but of course the weekend and holiday don't count.  The rad. said Thursday, possibly even Wednesday. I don't have a breast surgeon yet as this came about at my routine mamo.  I can barely restrain myself from dialing now, but I don't want to call too soon if the results are ready later.  How much info can actually be obtained from the biopsy results?  I thought it would just be negative or positive, but I'm getting confused now as to whether ER and /or HER2 status can be obtained - and staging??  and is grading only after surgery? Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 12:42PM nancyjg wrote: I just got bad news, too. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 01:13PM nancyjg wrote: Thanks.  My husband will be home soon.  I must be in shock because I am fully functional.  All I know is moderately differentiated IDC with lobular features and some DCIS.  appt. monday with breast surgeon.  anybody in MA recommend a breast center?  Worcester or Boston? Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2010 12:47AM nancyjg wrote: Thanks everybody.  My appt. today is at UMASS Mem Breast Ctr, which is 20-25 minutes away and I have heard they have a good reputation.  What I know for certain, because of this site, is that I want to go to a breast center.  Today we meet with the surgeon and Wednesday we meet with the rest of the "team", the rad. onc, the med. onc. and the geneticist.  I find the idea of having a "team" of doctors comforting.  I'm really scared (again, it's 3:30am).  I should stop this and try to go back to sleep.  I know I'll have a lot more info after today.  I've known that I have breast cancer for 3 1/2 days.  I've told a total of maybe 10 people and each time I say it (or in one case, email it) it becomes more and more real.  I have this feeling that tomorrow I go from being "person who just received shocking test results" to "cancer patient".  I do not want to let this define me.  Ah, goodnight. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 11:22PM nancyjg wrote: Hi All.  Wednesday is over and went well. I had a lymph node biopsy done yesterday and the results were negative! Yay!  Although I understand that a sentinel node biopsy will still be done during surgery and one neg. lymph node does not mean this will come back neg. as well.  Still, great news!  We sat in a room today and each doctor came in one by one and told us their role in it all and answered any questions we had.  We were there for about 6 hours.  It was exhausting, overwhelming, and really really helpful.  I will be using this hospital (in Worcester) and not checking out other breast centers.  I feel I will get good care and just don't have it in me to do it all again. The breast surgeon and plastic surgeon in particular impressed my husband and I both.   I'm convinced my options won't change, and the decisions for what type of surgery are ultimately up to me.  Pray I'm choosing the right doctors and that I make the right decisions concerning surgery.  Please.  Best wishes to all, Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 01:35AM nancyjg wrote: Seaside _Memories, In answer to your question-how am I holding up-it is just after 4 am and I'm here on line.  Oh, and I just painted my toenails, you know, in case I have to take my shoes off at a doctor's office. Clearly I am certifiable.  I am supposed to be able to call for results today.  I don't know what time.  This is shaping up to be one long day. Laurakay, wishing you thoughts and prayers of strength and courage. Maria,  good luck today, soon you'll be home on the couch with an ice pack.  Hugs to all. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 02:36PM nancyjg wrote: Joyko, I wish you the best of luck tomorrow for your biopsy.  My thoughts will be with you.  I so agree with you about the heroic strength of the women on this site.  It really helps to be able to write what I'm feeling without fear of judgement. Laura, a prayer for you, too. And ALL of our kids. Nancy
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: nancyjg wrote: I underwent left breast mastectomy with tissue expander March 2010, silicone implant placement with right breast augmentation for symmetry July 2010.  By the grace of God I needed neither chemo nor radiation therapy.  I feel I can say I'm cancer free!!!!(taking tamoxifen)  I am now trying to decide whether or not to have nipple reconstruction on my new left breast.  My breasts look even-sized-though I would NOT say my left breast looks natural.  It's not just the scar, I know that will fade, it's just the general shape and the way it looks when I move my chest muscle.  It is still sore when I do much of anything involving my left arm (which is weak)  It hurts when I wear a bra-any bra-or a shirt that isn't quite loose.  So. . . .I generally go braless.  I have found I can put a little "petal" over my right nipple and in lots of clothes this works just fine.  My fear is that I will have nipple reconstruction, end up with a nipple that really doesn't look real anyway and have to wear a painful bra everyday.  My fear if I forgo this surgery is that I will regret it in the future, long after insurance would cover it!  Also- I am really really tired of surgery.  I want to be well, get in shape again, feel normal.  I want to put this "the year of the breast cancer" behind me.  Help. . . . please, if anyone has experienced something similar, or just has advice, it's all I can think about Nancy  Dx 2/18/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: nipple reconstruction? nancyjg mawhinney

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2010 02:01PM nancyjg wrote: Hi HairSsprayMom, I will be having a left breast mx (so far, still waiting for MRI results taking a closer look at right) and am interested in your aprons.  For some reason, I am really freaked out about the drains and how to deal with them.  Maybe it's just easier to concentrate on anything besides the word cancer, but anything that will make things easier will really be helpful.  Where do we go from here?  I don't know how to PM. Thanks, Nancy
Posts.Title: Do you need a mastec/recon apron? HairSprayMom HairSprayMom

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2010 05:03PM nancyjg wrote: Good Luck Joyce, I know all will go well tomorrow.  My thoughts and prayers will be with you.  Nancy

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 11:22AM nancyjg wrote: Thanks everybody for responding.  I was supposed to see the ps last week but had to cancel because of a snowstorm, see him 2/15.  I know he will be surprised I'm even questioning the natural next step.  I will read about 3D tats, see what that's all about.  I'm glad to hear the surgery isn't a big deal, because everything else so far has been!
